titles: A true and impartiall account of the plunderings, losses, and sufferings of the County of Hereford by the Scottish army, during their siege before the city of Hereford, Anno Dom. 1645. Since brought in by the country in writing. Published in this juncture of time for the undeceiving of the people, who may perhaps fancy to themselves some imaginable advantage by stickling for the Scots and their partizans in this nation. By Miles Hill, Gent.
author: Hill, Miles.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Scotland. --  Army --  History --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
